alert.note: Alert for Clarke (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clarke County through 200 PM CDT... At 114 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Putnam, or 14 miles west of Thomasville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thomasville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
